extendedInfo.description: Over 20,000 free chess tactics problems to learn and improve your skills in this fascinating game or just to have fun and keep your brain active!Available 7 difficulty levels that make the puzzle proposed suitable for both beginners and chess master!All exercises are taken from games played in the most important chess tournaments in the world.And now available IdeaTactics NoAds without commercials.Facebook Page: http://tinyurl.com/ideatactics

reviews.title: Good, but has mistakes
reviews.comment: Good. I m experienced chess player and based on my evaluation and my software Fritz analysis too some of these chess puzzle solutions are bit inaccurate. Same level has really easy and very hard puzzles......
reviews.author: Attila Sonkoly

reviews.title: Ok, but some features need to be reworked.
reviews.comment: App is OK for beginners and has a very good scale for difficulty. Some features have to be reworked: longer solution outputs cannot fit the screen and a lot of moves aren\'t visible, it would be good to be able to select specified problem.
reviews.author: Budo Zindovic

reviews.title: Good way to practice
reviews.comment: Shame it resets when you rotate the screen... Still a good app though!
reviews.author: Ido Sherman

reviews.comment: Great situations to help learn chess
reviews.author: Mark Klein

reviews.comment: Some ideal dont make sence
reviews.author: Danne Dittrich

reviews.title: Deepu
reviews.comment: wonderful app for beginner chess learner.
reviews.author: Kuldeep Vaid

reviews.comment: Excellent fun. Really handy that you can set graded problems.
reviews.author: Steve Topham

reviews.title: Excellent application!
reviews.comment: Great app to use for training! Just wish you could play through the solution over the board. Otherwise, great job! Thanks!
reviews.author: Rich Ahorro

reviews.title: Good app
reviews.comment: Great looking on nexus 7
reviews.author: scott kolb

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: EXCELLENT APP BUT SOME PUZZLES HAVE A MEANING LESS SOLUTION
reviews.author: Rajesh Bhuyan

reviews.title: Very nice chess training tool!
reviews.comment: Presents the user with a mix of tactical positions to solve (opening, middlegame, endgame). Allows to see the solution, a retry and has selectable difficulty levels. Some additional features that I would like to see: 1. Selection of endgame only positions 2. Navigation to the previous position 3. Sometimes, the final position is unclear to me, and allowing to test my moves with an engine would help
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Hmmm
reviews.comment: Problems are dumb one except for absolute beginners. Uninstall.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Poor features and simple problems
reviews.comment: Problems are too simple and their solutions sometimes wrong. Set of featured pretty poor.
reviews.author: Gennady Rakovchik

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment: Some problems I don\'t agree with. They wouldn\'t all work against an average player.
reviews.author: Steven Lochridge

reviews.title: Feedback
reviews.comment: It\'s great. I think is a good idea to show The possible moves yo know why os The best movement
reviews.author: Jaime Jim\303\251nez

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: I would give it five stars but sometimes it is hard to get it to recognize the piece you want to move by tapping it. I would recommend this app to others though. Keeps you sharp.
reviews.author: Michael Coy

reviews.title: No hints no score
reviews.comment: No complete logic to appreciate the correct move. You need to buy pro to get your score. Uninst.
reviews.author: Samer Shennar

reviews.title: I simply love it
reviews.comment: Simple UI. No ads. What more will one want?
reviews.author: Vikas Bhutra

reviews.comment: Good for making me think better at chess but I\'m pretty much a beginner so not always sure why certain moves are the best.\tWould like the ability to be able to go back 1 problem as I sometimes get the wrong button and end up skipping a problem. Had been fun working through the puzzles.
reviews.author: M Hesslegrave

reviews.title: Not bad
reviews.comment: But difficulty level varies significantly between trivial and W T F. Why???  Otherwise for something like this for free you really don\'t have any justification to complain
reviews.author: Frank Schneider
